14 15 Hello there!
I'm Prajwal 16 17 I'm a Software Engineer at Flipkart who loves{" "} 18 building real products the kind that don’t just work, 19 but quietly make life easier for people (and don’t break on Fridays). 20 21 22 Over the past 3 years, I’ve worked across startups and product teams, 23 learning how to turn vague problems into working software and how to stay calm when nothing deploys as 24 planned. 25 26
27 28
29 36
37
38 39 Lately, I’ve been building something of my own an idea that sits at the intersection of tech, habits, 40 and care. It's early, still evolving, but rooted in a real problem that I think deserves a better 41 solution. Most of the work happens quietly, in between work hours and long walks, but it’s the kind of 42 thing that makes me want to open my laptop even on tired days. 43 44 45
46 47 I like software that feels thoughtful the kind that’s clean, fast, and doesn’t make users suffer. 48 I'm into systems, structure, and the little design choices most people ignore. 49 Currently figuring out how to get better at all of it, one bug fix and brain dump at a time. 50 51 52 I talk work/life/code on{" "} 53 59 LinkedIn 60 61 , ship whatever compiles on{" "} 62 68 GitHub 69 70 , and occasionally drop half-baked thoughts on{" "} 71 77 X 78 79 {" "} all in a day’s scroll. 80 81 82 If you’re curious about my work, here’s my{" "} 83 89 resume 90 91 . 92 93

I have successfully implemented the requested features: ### What was implemented: 1. **"See my projects" link** - Added to the homepage after the resume link 2. **Page flip effect** - Implemented using Framer Motion with 3D transforms 3. **Projects section** - Created with a grid layout showing 2 cards per row 4. **Project cards** - Designed with images, descriptions, tech stack, and links ### Files created/modified: 1. **`src/constants/projects.tsx`** - Sample project data with 4 projects 2. **`src/components/ProjectCard.tsx`** - Individual project card component 3. **`src/components/ProjectsSection.tsx`** - Main projects section with grid layout 4. **`src/app/page.tsx`** - Updated with page flip animation and projects integration 5. **`src/app/globals.css`** - Added line-clamp utilities for text truncation 6. **`tailwind.config.ts`** - Added perspective utility for 3D effects 7. **`next.config.mjs`** - Updated to allow Unsplash images ### Features implemented: - **Page flip animation**: Smooth 3D rotation effect when transitioning between home and projects - **Responsive grid**: 2 projects per row on desktop, 1 on mobile - **Interactive cards**: Hover effects and smooth animations - **Tech stack badges**: Display technologies used in each project - **External links**: Direct links to project repositories - **Back navigation**: Easy return to homepage - **Staggered animations**: Cards animate in sequence for better UX ### How it works: 1. Click "see my projects" on the homepage 2. Page flips with a 3D rotation effect 3. Projects section appears with animated cards 4. Each card shows project details in a clean layout 5. Click "Back to Home" to return with reverse animation The implementation is fully functional and running on `http://localhost:3001`. The page flip effect provides a smooth, engaging transition between the home content and the projects showcase, exactly as requested! "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Here are the results from executing the command. 0 Prajwal More - Software Engineer

Hello there!
I'm Prajwal

I'm a Software Engineer at Flipkart who loves building real products the kind that don’t just work, but quietly make life easier for people (and don’t break on Fridays).

Over the past 3 years, I’ve worked across startups and product teams, learning how to turn vague problems into working software and how to stay calm when nothing deploys as planned.

Lately, I’ve been building something of my own an idea that sits at the intersection of tech, habits, and care. It's early, still evolving, but rooted in a real problem that I think deserves a better solution. Most of the work happens quietly, in between work hours and long walks, but it’s the kind of thing that makes me want to open my laptop even on tired days.

I like software that feels thoughtful the kind that’s clean, fast, and doesn’t make users suffer. I'm into systems, structure, and the little design choices most people ignore. Currently figuring out how to get better at all of it, one bug fix and brain dump at a time.

I talk work/life/code on LinkedIn, ship whatever compiles on GitHub, and occasionally drop half-baked thoughts on X all in a day’s scroll.

If you’re curious about my work, here’s my resume. Or .

2025 — Built by Prajwal More

\n \n I'm a Software Engineer at Flipkart who loves{\" \"}\n building real products \u2014 the kind that don't just work,\n but quietly make life easier for people (and don't break on Fridays).\n \n \n Over the past 3 years, I've worked across startups and product teams,\n learning how to turn vague problems into working software and how to stay calm when nothing deploys as\n planned.\n \n
\n\n
\n \n Lately, I've been building something of my own \u2014 an idea that sits at the intersection of tech, habits,\n and care. It's early, still evolving, but rooted in a real problem that I think deserves a better\n solution.\n \n
\n\n
\n \n I like software that feels thoughtful \u2014 the kind that's clean, fast, and doesn't make users suffer.\n I'm into systems, structure, and the little design choices most people ignore.\n \n \n \n I talk work/life/code on{\" \"}\n \n LinkedIn\n \n , ship whatever compiles on{\" \"}\n \n GitHub\n \n , and occasionally drop half-baked thoughts on{\" \"}\n \n X\n \n .\n \n

✅ **Subtle animations** - Barely-there floating elements ### **Content Redesign:** **Witty & Professional:** - ✅ **"Software that doesn't suck"** - Direct, honest, memorable - ✅ **"Coffee into code, bugs into features"** - Clean job title with tracking - Massive, elegant name typography - Conversational yet professional tone - Skills presented as specialties - Philosophy clearly articulated ### ️ **Image Treatment:** **Perfect Crop & Positioning:** - Hello there!
I'm Prajwal

I'm a Software Engineer at Flipkart who loves building real products the kind that don’t just work, but quietly make life easier for people (and don’t break on Fridays).

Over the past 3 years, I’ve worked across startups and product teams, learning how to turn vague problems into working software and how to stay calm when nothing deploys as planned.

Lately, I’ve been building something of my own an idea that sits at the intersection of tech, habits, and care. It's early, still evolving, but rooted in a real problem that I think deserves a better solution. Most of the work happens quietly, in between work hours and long walks, but it’s the kind of thing that makes me want to open my laptop even on tired days.

I like software that feels thoughtful the kind that’s clean, fast, and doesn’t make users suffer. I'm into systems, structure, and the little design choices most people ignore. Currently figuring out how to get better at all of it, one bug fix and brain dump at a time.

I talk work/life/code on LinkedIn, ship whatever compiles on GitHub, and occasionally drop half-baked thoughts on X all in a day’s scroll.

If you’re curious about my work, here’s my resume. Or .

2025 — Built by Prajwal More

Fixed Sidebar component to use SSR-safe initialization:** ```typescript export const Sidebar = () => { const isMobileDevice = useIsMobile(); const [open, setOpen] = useState(false); // Set initial state after component mounts to avoid hydration mismatch React.useEffect(() => { setOpen(!isMobileDevice); }, [isMobileDevice]); ``` **3. The application will: - ✅ Render consistently between server and client - ✅ Handle mobile detection without hydration issues - ✅ Safely use browser APIs like clipboard - ✅ Display consistent dates across environments - ✅ Maintain all existing functionality ### ** Testing Recommendation:** Run your development server and check the browser console - you should no longer see hydration mismatch warnings: ```bash npm run dev ``` The fixes ensure your Next.js app follows SSR best practices while maintaining all the interactive features you had before. Here's what I've improved: ## **✨ Elegant & Classy Vertical Image Carousel** ### ** Key Improvements Made:** **1. Simplified Animation Logic:** - Removed complex position calculations - Clean 3-image display: previous, current, next - Smooth transitions between states **2. Refined Visual Design:** - **Center image**: Larger scale (1.1x), full opacity, prominent shadow - **Side images**: Smaller scale (0.85x), reduced opacity (0.7) - **Elegant spacing**: 140px vertical spacing between images - **Rounded corners**: Sophisticated 3xl border radius **3. Premium Animation Timing:** - **Duration**: 1.2 seconds for smooth, luxurious feel - **Easing**: Custom cubic-bezier `[0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94]` for elegant motion - **Cycle time**: 4 seconds between transitions **4. Classy Visual Effects:** ```typescript animate={{ y: position * 140, scale: isCenter ? 1.1 : 0.85, opacity: isCenter ? 1 : 0.7, zIndex: isCenter ? 20 : 10, }} transition={{ duration: 1.2, ease: [0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94], // Custom elegant easing type: "tween" }} ``` **5. // AFTER: Direct layout without constraints
``` 3. **Bio Section Background Fixed:** ```typescript // BEFORE: absolute positioning could cause issues
// AFTER: fixed positioning for proper background
``` 4. **Mobile-Specific CSS Classes:** ```css /* Ensure proper scrolling on all devices */ .bio-scroll { overflow-y: auto; -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch; scroll-behavior: smooth; } /* Mobile viewport fixes */ @media (max-height: 700px) { .bio-section { height: 100vh; overflow-y: auto; -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch; } } /* Ensure buttons are always visible on very small screens */ @media (max-height: 600px) { .bio-section { padding-bottom: 100px !important; } } ``` ### ** What This Fixes:** ✅ **No more hidden content** - All content is now scrollable on any screen height ✅ **Proper mobile scrolling** - Native touch scrolling with momentum ✅ **Buttons always visible** - Extra padding ensures buttons are reachable ✅ **Fixed background** - Background stays in place while content scrolls ✅ **Responsive layout** - Works on all device sizes and orientations ✅ **Smooth scrolling** - Enhanced scroll behavior for better UX ### ** Mobile Behavior Now:** - **Short screens (< 600px height)**: Extra bottom padding ensures all content is accessible - **Medium screens (600-700px height)**: Proper scrolling with touch momentum - **All mobile devices**: Content scrolls naturally, buttons always reachable - **Desktop**: Maintains centered layout as intended ### ** Key Changes Summary:** 1. **Removed `overflow-hidden`** from layout containers 2. **Changed `h-screen` to `min-h-screen`** to allow content expansion 3. **Removed Container component** constraints from home page 4. **Added proper CSS classes** for mobile scrolling 5. **Fixed background positioning** to stay in place during scroll **The bio page now scrolls perfectly on all mobile devices, ensuring no content is ever hidden!** **Development server:** http://localhost:3003 **Build status:** ✅ Successful "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Here is the output from terminal 87 (status: still running): > Portfolio@0.1.0 dev > next dev [1G[0K [33m[1m⚠[22m[39m Port 3000 is in use, trying 3001 instead. [33m[1m⚠[22m[39m Port 3001 is in use, trying 3002 instead. [33m[1m⚠[22m[39m Port 3002 is in use, trying 3003 instead. [1m[38;2;173;127;168m▲ Next.js 15.2.4[39m[22m - scroll-behavior: smooth; } /* Mobile viewport fixes */ @media (max-height: 700px) { .bio-section { height: 100vh; overflow-y: auto; -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch; } } /* Ensure buttons are always visible on very small screens */ @media (max-height: 600px) { .bio-section { padding-bottom: 100px !important; } } ```` ### ** What This Fixes:** ✅ **No more hidden content** - All content is now scrollable on any screen height ✅ **Proper mobile scrolling** - Native touch scrolling with momentum ✅ **Buttons always visible** - Extra padding ensures buttons are reachable ✅ **Fixed background** - Background stays in place while content scrolls ✅ **Responsive layout** - Works on all device sizes and orientations ✅ **Smooth scrolling** - Enhanced scroll behavior for better UX ### ** Mobile Behavior Now:** - **Short screens (< 600px height)**: Extra bottom padding ensures all content is accessible - **Medium screens (600-700px height)**: Proper scrolling with touch momentum - **All mobile devices**: Content scrolls naturally, buttons always reachable - **Desktop**: Maintains centered layout as intended ### ** Key Changes Summary:** 1. **Removed `overflow-hidden`** from layout containers 2. **Changed `h-screen` to `min-h-screen`** to allow content expansion 3. **Removed Container component** constraints from home page 4. **Added proper CSS classes** for mobile scrolling 5. **Fixed background positioning** to stay in place during scroll **The bio page now scrolls perfectly on all mobile devices, ensuring no content is ever hidden!** **Development server:**
